sub_title: Aviation and travel industry leader, now relishing personal life and projects.
summary:
Jeff is a recognised aviation industry leader with strong interpersonal and management skills and a highly successful track record of delivering results. 

Jeff’s strengths are strategic thinking and implementation; negotiation, analysis and influencing; diplomacy; advocacy and communications; change management; understanding of governments and regulatory environments; public affairs; good governance; business development; commercial, contractual and procurement; and team management, coaching, mentoring and motivation. 

A global traveller with many years of international business experience, Jeff is very comfortable and capable in discussions at the highest levels of governments, industry, academia, media and the public, all with strong cultural sensitivity and awareness. He is an experienced public speaker used to high media exposure.

Jeff has wide experience of serving as Board member or non-executive Director for a number of very different organisations as well as serving on high-level government, institution and industry groups and committees.

He was also responsible for IATA's commercial fuel activities, including fuel charges and reliability of fuel supply, and for industry taxation matters affecting IATA Member airlines. 
Under Jeff’s personal leadership, the IATA External Costs Campaign has secured savings for airlines of over US$ 24 billion from reduced charges, fees and taxes and has consistently exceeded the annual targets set by the IATA Board of Governors.  This success was achieved by hard campaign lobbying and media coverage but also through much improved relationships with airports, air navigation service providers and governments (Director Generals of Civil Aviation and Ministers of Transport) around the world; also, with strong management of a small but very capable, hand-selected team.
Jeff led IATA’s efforts on the Single European Sky for Europe under which improved air traffic management will bring significant benefits in safety, operations, costs and environment.  Jeff was appointed by European Commissioner Jacques Barrot on a personal basis to the European Commission’s High Level Group on the Single European Sky.  The High Level Group made strong recommendations that the European Commission is now implementing through the Single European Sky Package 2 legislation.
